acceptance_tests: Player can start a new game and control falling tetrominoes
Tetrominoes lock in place when they reach the bottom or collide
Completed horizontal lines are detected and cleared correctly
Game ends when new tetrominoes can no longer enter the playfield

constraints.quality: Gameplay must be stable and deterministic
constraints.scope: Initial version should focus on core gameplay rather than platform-specific optimizations

goal: Design and implement a new version of the game Tetris with core gameplay mechanics faithfully represented.
open_questions: What target platform(s) should this Tetris game run on (web, mobile, desktop, console)?
What programming language or engine should be used?
Is this intended to be a classic Tetris clone or a reimagined version with new mechanics?
Are there any branding, licensing, or originality constraints to consider?
recommendations: Start with a minimal playable prototype before expanding features
Separate game logic from rendering to allow easier future platform support
Use well-known Tetris rotation and randomization systems for predictable gameplay

can: Support multiple visual themes or skins
Include modern Tetris features such as hold piece
must: Implement core Tetris gameplay mechanics (falling tetrominoes, grid-based playfield, line clearing)
Include standard tetromino shapes with rotation and collision rules
Provide a playable game loop with win/lose conditions
Allow player control over piece movement and rotation
should: Include scoring based on lines cleared
Increase difficulty over time (e.g., falling speed)
Provide a restart or new game option
